real_word: it[pronoun](usually as the subject of the verb be) used to give emphasis to a certain word or phrase.
it[pronoun]used as a subject in certain kinds of sentences eg in talking about the weather, distance or time.
it[pronoun](used as the subject of a verb or object of a verb or preposition) the thing spoken of, used especially of lifeless things and of situations, but also of animals and babies.
so[adverb](used in place of a word, phrase etc previously used, or something previously stated) as already indicated.
to[preposition]used instead of a complete infinitive.
the[definite article]used to refer to a person, thing etc mentioned previously, described in a following phrase, or already known.
the[definite article]used with a singular noun or an adjective to refer to all members of a group etc or to a general type of object, group of objects etc.
the[definite article]used to refer to unique objects etc, especially in titles and names.
the[definite article]used after a preposition with words referring to a unit of quantity, time etc.
the[definite article]used with superlative adjectives and adverbs to denote a person, thing etc which is or shows more of something than any other.
in[preposition]describing the position of a thing etc which is surrounded by something else.
in[preposition]showing the direction of movement.
in[preposition]describing the time at, after or within which something happens.
in[preposition]indicating amount or relative number.
in[preposition]expressing circumstances, state, manner etc of an event, person etc.
at[preposition]showing a state or occupation.
into[preposition]to or towards the inside of; to within.
into[preposition]to the state or condition of.
on[preposition]in or into (a vehicle, train etc).
on[preposition]taking part in.
on[preposition]near or beside.
to[preposition]into a particular state or condition.
along[preposition]at a point at the end or on the length of.
under[preposition]used to express various states.
inside[preposition](sometimes (especially American) with of) within; to or on the inside of.
in-[prefix]used in adjectives, adjectives, and nouns to mean ‘not’, ‘no’, or ‘the opposite of’.
a, an[indefinite article]one.
a, an[indefinite article]any; every.
this[adjective]used in stories to indicate a person, thing etc that one is describing or about to describe.
one[number]the age of 1.
one[number]the number or figure 1.
ace[noun]the “one” on dominoes or dice..
and[conjunction]joining two statements, pieces of information etc.
and[conjunction]in addition to.
on[preposition]touching, fixed to, covering etc the upper or outer side of.
at[preposition]showing time.
on[preposition]by means of.
on[preposition]near or beside.
on[preposition]receiving, taking.
on[preposition]supported by.
on[preposition]at or during a certain day, time etc.
to[preposition]used in expressing various relations.
upon[preposition]on.
up[preposition]towards the source of (a river).
up[preposition]to or at a higher level on.
up[preposition](at a place) along.
at[preposition]showing position.
down[preposition]in a lower position on.
finished[adjective]having been completely used, eaten etc.
up[adverb, adjective]erect.
up[adverb, adjective]out of bed.
up[adverb, adjective]used to indicate completeness; thoroughly or finally.
be[verb]used with a present participle to form the progressive or continuous tenses.
be[verb]used with a past participle to form the passive voice.
be[verb]used in giving or asking for information about something or someone.
go[verb]to be.
hold[verb]to keep (oneself), or to be, in a particular state or condition.
centre, center[verb]to place, or to be, at the centre/center..
his[adjective, pronoun]belonging to a male person already spoken about.
its[adjective]belonging to it.
their[adjective]used instead of his, his or her etc where a person of unknown sex or people of both sexes are referred to.
